messages: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:46): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: Did you have some plan for keeping Mozilla's reftest submissions in sync with the hg repository, or should I just assume that they've been forked?

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (23:51): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, no plan, though I'd prefer not to fork, and it's easier to edit on the mozilla side since they're script-converted to the W3C format
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:52): Oh are CSS actually using reftests now? Intersting
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:52): Where is the W3C format documented?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:54): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: http://wiki.csswg.org/test/reftest
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:55): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: are those scripts in hg?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:55): is fine with editing in hg and exporting, but needs to do this today
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Although I need to tweak that a bit since we're not actually using a reftest subdir
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): wrote that up as notes to self when writing the build scripts
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (23:56): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, they're not in hg
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:56): So you are now enabling the advanced features of the Mozilla reftest format like delaying the screenshots?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:57): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: just straight-up equality comparisons atm
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:57): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: we can do fancy stuff later if needed, but probably not in time for 2.1
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:58): I guess for 2.1 it is fine as is
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:58): But some more dynamic stuff will presumably need more complexity
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): yeah
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:59): I heard the reftest manifest format is changing, also
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:59): definitely don't want to add fancy stuff right before that happens!
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:00): I think Mozilla are going JSON
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:00): right
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:00): The plan is to stay in sync with that?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:00): eventually, I would think so
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:00): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: Can you put them in hg?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:01): Not right now
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:01): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: One of the advantages of having tests at w3c is so that vendors can share them
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:01): I'm trying to hold 2 bug fixes in my head that I need towrite down
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:01): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: when?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:01): ok
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: reftests aren't well-established elsewhere yet, so if Mozilla's changing formats we should match them

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:09): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, there wasn't really a script... it was just a list of which tests to include, and then a single command that ran each one through html2xhtml.py, which I can email you
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:09): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, emailed
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:10): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, I don't think Mozilla is going JSON.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: so how about I run the conversion in Mozilla's repository instead of having to run it every time we need to sync?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:12): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, no
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:12): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, I want Mozilla's tests to be in the format that actually matters.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:12): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, Reducing the input space is bad.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:12): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, the variation in test styles from different test authors, etc., gives us better test coverage
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, I don't understand
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, ok
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, have you made any changes to those tests since importing, or would reimporting them give the same results?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:17): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: Oh, there was some blog post that suggested you were. Maybe the interets were wrong
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:26): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, also do you have the list of tests to export, or should I just make one?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:27): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, we're arguing about it
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:27): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, I don't think they've changed

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:28): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, and the list is in http://hg.mozilla.org/users 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01_mozilla.com/patches-clean/raw-file/9b79254a7fe5/css21-contribute-temp-manifests
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:28): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, you probably don't want to re-import the amnifests
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:28): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, and I added one test in a different directory rather than make  anew one, but that could be changed
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (00:29): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d, back in a bit
